definition: to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: This doesn’t mean that you should sit on your couch all day.
sentences.chinese: 當然這並不意味着你應該整天坐在沙發上無所事事。

sentences.english: There was no work in the office this afternoon so everyone idled about.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午辦公室裏沒事幹，所以大家都無所事事。

sentences.english: One worked all summer and the other sat on his duff.
sentences.chinese: 一個兒子整個夏季都在工作而另一個無所事事。

sentences.english: I am only interested in sitting in a boat and doing nothing at all.
sentences.chinese: 我只是對獨坐孤舟無所事事感興趣。

sentences.english: Her son is just bumming around.
sentences.chinese: 好的兒子總是無所事事。
別整天吊兒郎當無所事事。

sentences.english: He wasted a tolerably large allowance, something like three thousand francs a year, in doing nothing.
sentences.chinese: 他無所事事地喫着一筆相當大的學膳費，三千法郎。

sentences.english: A complex creative intelligence with nothing to do is not just redundant.
sentences.chinese: 一個無所事事的複雜的創造性智慧不僅僅是多餘的。

sentences.english: Those teenagers just hang around the mall with nothing to do.
sentences.chinese: 那些年輕人只是在購物中心閒逛，無所事事。

sentences.english: One disadvantage of having nothing to do is you can't stop and rest. ----Franklin Jones.
sentences.chinese: 無所事事的缺點之一是你不能停下來休息。

sentences.english: By all evidence we are in the world to do nothing.
sentences.chinese: 所有的證據顯示，我們在這個世上無所事事。

sentences.english: "I will not be bored, " Raikkonen said.
sentences.chinese: “我不會無所事事，”萊科寧表示。

sentences.english: The boys wandered around the town with nothing to do.
sentences.chinese: 那些男孩無所事事，在鎮上到處閒逛。

sentences.english: She can't sit around and do nothing.
sentences.chinese: 她總不能閒坐着無所事事呀。

sentences.english: Illidan had not been idle in Tyrande's absence.
sentences.chinese: 泰蘭德不在的時候伊利丹並沒有無所事事。

sentences.english: After that, Daedalus was idle no longer.
sentences.chinese: 從那以後，代達羅斯不再無所事事了。

definition: to abandon (cultivated fields)/no longer cultivated/to lie waste/wasted/to neglect (one's work or study)
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
to stare blankly/to be stunned/to be lost in thought
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
cheerful and optimistic/in a good mood/gaily
